meanings.definition: A person who is unwilling to take risks or make a big effort.
meanings.sent1: Some people think that successful entrepreneurs are brave risk-takers, not pikers.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a piker when it comes to chasing your dreams; take a leap of faith!
meanings.sent3: At the team-building retreat, John was labeled a piker for always avoiding challenging tasks.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the hero faced the dragon head-on, while the piker hid behind a rock.
meanings.sent5: The image of a piker is like a shadow that never steps into the light of opportunity.

meanings.definition: A person who is stingy or unwilling to spend money.
meanings.sent1: My uncle is known as a piker because he never treats anyone to lunch.
meanings.sent2: Being a piker may save money in the short term, but it can strain relationships.
meanings.sent3: During the charity event, the piker refused to donate even a penny.
meanings.sent4: Her reputation as a piker spread faster than wildfire in a dry forest.
meanings.sent5: The piker's wallet was like a fortress, impenetrable to any spending.

meanings.definition: A person who is unreliable or untrustworthy.
meanings.sent1: You can't rely on a piker to show up on time for important meetings.
meanings.sent2: The team lost the game because one of the players turned out to be a piker.
meanings.sent3: When it comes to keeping secrets, Sarah is a real piker; she can't help but gossip.
meanings.sent4: His promises were as empty as the pockets of a piker in a casino.
meanings.sent5: The piker's words were like shifting sands, never providing a solid foundation of trust.
